intro: Thesium ramosum var. divaricatum, commonly known as the slender thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered yellow flowers. Native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces a distinctive, spiky inflorescence. It is often found in open woodlands and savannas, where it plays a minor role in the local flora.
